name: Wasp
headline: Configuration language for building enterprise web apps 10x faster
description:
Wasp is a simple configuration language for building enterprise web apps with less code and best practices. If a developer wants to build an app like Instacart, they need to know a dozen different technologies and how to make them work together - Wasp solves this problem while still letting developers use React, Node.js and their other favourite tools.

We will enable enterprises to build modern apps quickly at scale, like Databricks did for data management.

founders.name: Matija ≈†o≈°iƒá, Founder
founders.description:
Comp Sci MSc & Software Engineer.
I am excited about clean code, functional programming, web dev, building teams and useful products. In my free time I enjoy calisthenics and photography.

Experience:
- led engineering team at Lifebit Biotech
- Techstars Tech Associate (London), cohort of 2017
- CEO & Co-founder @ TalkBook (https://talkbook.co/home)
- Noom, New York - SWE internship (2014)
- A*Star, Bioinformatics institute Singapore - research internship (2011)

founders.name: Martin Sosic, Founder
founders.description:
Software engineer, computer scientist (M.Sc.) and entrepreneur.
I am excited about building a product, open source, functional programming, web development, clean code, customer development.
Ex algorithmic competitor, SWE intern at Google, Palantir and Bioinformatic Institute (Singapore), author of Edlib library, dev associate at Techstars 2017, founder of Talkbook (startup), led engineering team at Lifebit.ai.
I love mechanical keyboards, emacs, calisthenics and playing instruments.

markdown:
raw_markdown='Your Docusaurus site did not load properly.
A very common reason is a wrong site [baseUrl configuration](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/docusaurus.io/docs/docusaurus.config.js/#baseUrl>).
Current configured baseUrl = / (default value)
We suggest trying baseUrl = /
**üêù Wasp v0.16 is here! üêù** See what's new ‚öôÔ∏è ‚Üí
Open menu
[![Wasp Logo](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/wasp-logo.png)](https://wasp-lang.dev/</>)Wasp Œ≤eta
[Docs](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs>)[Blog](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog>)[FAQ](https://wasp-lang.dev/<#faq>)[üì¨ Join the list](https://wasp-lang.dev/<#signup>)
[Star us on GitHub](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp>)[Get Started](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/quick-start>)[GitHub](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp>)[Discord](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/discord.gg/rzdnErX>)[X](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/twitter.com/WaspLang>)
# Develop full-stack web apps faster.
Rails-like framework for React, Node.js and Prisma. Build your app in a day and deploy it with a single CLI command.
[Get Started](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/quick-start>)[Documentation](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs>)
Works with
![React](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/react-logo-gray.svg)![Node](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/nodejs-logo-gray.svg)![Prisma](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/prisma-logo-gray.svg)
Backed by![YC](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/yc-logo-rounded.png)
[todoApp.wasp¬∑ Wasp config file](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/blob/release/examples/todo-typescript/main.wasp>)
```

apptodoApp{
title: "ToDo App",// visible in the browser tab
auth: {// full-stack auth out-of-the-box
userEntity: User,
methods: {google: {},gitHub: {},email: {...}}
}
}
routeRootRoute{path: "/",to: MainPage}
pageMainPage{
authRequired: true,// Limit access to logged in users.
component: import Main from"@client/Main.tsx"// Your React code.
}
querygetTasks{
fn: import{ getTasks }from"@server/tasks.js",// Your Node.js code.
entities: [Task]// Automatic cache invalidation.
}

```

[schema.prisma¬∑ Wasp entities schema](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/blob/release/examples/todo-typescript/schema.prisma>)
```

model Task{...}// Your Prisma data model

```

Open Source
This is the way. Wasp is fully open-source and you're welcome to contribute! 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp>)
Full-stack Auth
Add login with social providers or email in a few lines of code with powerful UI helpers. No third party vendor lock-in. 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog/2023/04/12/auth-ui>)
RPC (Client <-> Server)
Wasp provides a typesafe RPC layer that instantly brings your data models and server logic to the client. 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/data-model/operations/overview>)
Simple Deployment
Deploy your app to any platform. Wasp offers CLI helpers for the most popular options. 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/deployment/intro>)
Jobs
Easily define, schedule and run specialized server tasks. Persistent, retryable, delayable. 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/advanced/jobs>)
Email Sending
All you need to do is connect an email provider and you can send emails! 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/advanced/email>)
Full-stack Type Safety
Full support for TypeScript with auto-generated types that span the whole stack. 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/tutorial/queries#implementing-a-query>)
And More!
Custom API routes, database seeding, optimistic updates, automatic cache invalidation on the client, ... 
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs>)
## How does it work? üßê
Given a simple `.wasp` configuration file that describes the high-level details of your web app, and `.js(x)/.css/...`, source files with your unique logic, Wasp compiler generates the full source of your web app in the target stack: front-end, back-end and deployment. This unique approach is what makes Wasp "smart" and gives it its super powers!
#### Simple config language
Declaratively describe high-level details of your app.
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/general/language>)
#### Wasp CLI
All the handy commands at your fingertips.
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/general/cli>)
#### React / Node.js / Prisma
You are still writing 90% of the code in your favorite technologies.
#### Goodbye boilerplate
Write only the code that matters, let Wasp handle the rest.
[Learn more](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5nsBbLvKnU>)
![React](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/wasp-compilation-diagram.png)
## Show, don't tell.
Take a look at examples - see how things work and get inspired for your next project.
#### Todo App (TypeScript) ‚úÖ
A famous To-Do list app, implemented in TypeScript.
![wasp GitHub profile picture](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/55102317)wasp
[todo-typescript](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/tree/release/examples/todo-typescript>)
[See the code](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/tree/release/examples/todo-typescript>)
#### CoverLetterGPT ü§ñ
Generate cover letters based on your CV and the job description. Powered by ChatGPT.
![vincanger GitHub profile picture](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/70215737)vincanger
[coverlettergpt](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/vincanger/coverlettergpt>)
[See the code](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/vincanger/coverlettergpt>)[Demo](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/coverlettergpt.xyz/>)
#### Realtime voting via WebSockets üîå
A realtime, websockets-powered voting app built with Wasp and TypeScript.
![wasp GitHub profile picture](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/55102317)wasp
[websockets-realtime-voting](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/tree/release/examples/websockets-realtime-voting>)
[See the code](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/tree/release/examples/websockets-realtime-voting>)[Demo](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/websockets-voting-client.fly.dev/login>)
[See all examples](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/tree/release/examples>)
## You're in a good crowd
Here's what folks using Wasp say about it. Join [our Discord](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/discord.gg/rzdnErX>) for more!
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/tm/reyero.jpg) Joan Reyero@joanreyero ![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/ph-logo.png) I spent the one weekend building with Wasp and it was amazing, a real pleasure. I normally develop in Vue.js, but in a weekend I had time to learn Wasp, React and finish a full-stack app (only missing styling). This would have been impossible before. So glad to see Wasp in Beta! üçª](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/www.producthunt.com/posts/wasp-lang-beta?comment=2048094>)
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/tm/tskaggs.png) Tim ‚úåÔ∏è@tskaggs ![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/twitter-logo.png) The simplification of the main.wasp file is üëç. And it feels like a very light weight version of a few larger frameworks.](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/twitter.com/tskaggs/status/1602513968207101954>)
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/tm/attila.jpg) Attila Vago@AttilaTheDev ![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/twitter-logo.png) @WaspLang has been in the back of my mind for months now. It left an impression, and I‚Äôm really not easy to impress. That‚Äôs gotta mean something‚Ä¶ #programming #webdevelopment #FullStack](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/twitter.com/AttilaTheDev/status/1583530646047117317>)
üêù Load more
## üèÜ Showcase Gallery üèÜ
See what others are building with Wasp.
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/showcase/farnance-dashboard.png)Farnance: SaaS marketplace for farmershackathonmaterial-uiSee how Julian won HackLBS 2021 among 250 participants and why Wasp was instrumental for the team's victory.](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog/2022/10/28/farnance-hackathon-winner>)
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/showcase/grabbit-hero.png)Grabbit: Easily manage dev environmentsinternal-toolsSee how Michael built and deployed an internal tool for managing dev resources at StudentBeans.](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog/2022/11/26/michael-curry-usecase>)
[![](https://wasp-lang.dev/img/lp/showcase/amicus-landing.png)Amicus: Task and workflow management for legal teamsstartupmaterial-uiSee how Erlis rolled out fully-fledged SaaS as a team of one in record time and got first paying customers.](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog/2022/11/26/erlis-amicus-usecase>)
## Stay up to date üì¨
Be the first to know when we ship new features and updates!
Subscribe
## üöß Roadmap üöß
Work on Wasp never stops: get a glimpse of what is coming next!
Right behind the corner
  * Improve Prisma support (more features, IDE) [641](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/641>)
  * Add TS eDSL, next to Wasp DSL [551](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/551>)
  * Make Wasp Auth usable in external services [1973](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/1973>)
  * Add more social providers to Wasp Auth [2016](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/2016>)
  * Support for SSR / SSG [911](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/911>)
  * Full-Stack Modules (aka FSMs: think RoR Engines)


Further down the road
  * Multiple targets (e.g. mobile) [1088](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/1088>)
  * Automatic generation of API for Operations [863](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/863>)
  * Top-level data schema [642](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/642>)
  * Complex arch (multiple servers, clients, serverless)
  * Polyglot (Python, Rust, Go, ...) [1940](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp/issues/1940>)
  * Multiple frontend libraries (Vue, Svelte, ...)


## Frequently asked questions
For anything not covered here, join [our Discord](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/discord.gg/rzdnErX>)!
How is Wasp different from Next.js / Nuxt.js / Gatsby?
How is Wasp different from Ruby on Rails or Django?
How hard is it to learn Wasp?
Do you support only React & Node.js currently?
###### Docs
  * [Getting Started](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs>)
  * [Todo app tutorial](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/tutorial/create>)
  * [Language reference](https://wasp-lang.dev/</docs/general/language>)


###### Community
  * [Discord](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/discord.gg/rzdnErX>)
  * [Twitter](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/twitter.com/WaspLang>)
  * [GitHub](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/github.com/wasp-lang/wasp>)


###### Company
  * [Blog](https://wasp-lang.dev/</blog>)
  * [Careers](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/wasp-lang.notion.site/Wasp-Careers-59fd1682c80d446f92be5fa65cc17672>)
  * [Company](https://wasp-lang.dev/<https:/www.notion.so/wasp-lang/Founding-Engineer-at-Wasp-88a73838f7f04ab3aee1f8e1c1bee6dd#20569f14a8af452db10ae618d764d505>)


### Stay up to date
Join our mailing list and be the first to know when we ship new features and updates!

generated_description:
### Wasp: Building Enterprise Apps at Lightning Speed

**Overview of Wasp**

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's W21 batch, Wasp is a developer-focused company based in Zagreb, Croatia. Their mission? To enable developers to create sophisticated enterprise web applications **10 times faster** than traditional methods. By minimizing boilerplate and providing a simple configuration language, Wasp allows developers to focus on writing the essential code while leveraging tools like React, Node.js, and Prisma. Think of it as a Rails-like framework for modern web apps.

**The Problem Wasp Solves**

Developers often face the daunting task of mastering several technologies to build a web app, which can be frustrating and time-consuming. Wasp elegantly bridges this gap, offering a streamlined approach to application development. With Wasp, you don‚Äôt need to juggle multiple technologies; rather, you can write your app using a single `.wasp` file that clearly outlines your app‚Äôs structure and functionality.

**What Makes Wasp Unique?**

1. **Configuration Language**: Wasp employs a simple configuration syntax, allowing developers to define their application's core components without delving into excessive coding.
   
2. **Full-stack Framework**: It combines the power of popular frameworks like React for the frontend and Node.js for the backend while managing the complexities of deployment with ease.

3. **Open Source**: Wasp is fully open-source, encouraging developers to contribute and collaborate on enhancing its features. This accessibility and community-driven approach foster innovation.

4. **Type Safety**: It integrates seamlessly with TypeScript, ensuring type safety throughout your application. This means fewer runtime errors, leading to more robust applications.

5. **Rapid Development**: Developers can launch an entire app in just a day and make production deployments with a single command using a straightforward CLI.

**Current Features**

Wasp supports a plethora of functionalities that simplify the development lifecycle:

- **Authentication**: Built-in full-stack authentication options with various methods (Google, GitHub, email).
- **Data Management**: A typesafe RPC layer that connects client-server logic directly, eliminating tedious backend calls.
- **Job Scheduling**: Tools for defining and running scheduled tasks on the server.
- **Custom Deployments**: Wasp's CLI helpers guide users through deploying applications to popular platforms.

**The Road Ahead**

Wasp is continually evolving, with a solid roadmap that includes improvements like expanding Prisma support, introducing more social authentication options, and adding support for server-side rendering (SSR). The founders are laser-focused on making Wasp an invaluable tool for developers.

**Community and Resources**

You can find even more about Wasp through their [website](https://wasp-lang.dev/), or join their community on [Discord](https://wasp-lang.dev/</discord>) to connect with fellow developers. The platform has garnered attention for its ease of use‚Äîsome users have managed to launch full-stack applications over a weekend!

**In Conclusion**

Wasp isn't just another development tool; it's a game changer for enterprise application development. By simplifying the process and providing robust capabilities, it allows developers to turn ideas into reality faster than ever. If you‚Äôre looking to build quickly while maintaining best practices, Wasp is definitely worth a look.
